sourceMeaningMnemonic: You find some <radical>white</radical> <radical>feathers</radical> and you want to <kanji>learn</kanji> more about where they came from and what they're made of.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself in a library poring through huge tomes on birds, feathers, and the history of white birds. You want to learn everything you can!
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>learn</kanji> that you should tie these white feathers to your <reading>shoe</reading>s (<ja>しゅう</ja>). You do it before you learn what it will do, and then suddenly you're jump-flying out of the building.
readingInfo: Oh geez, oh no. You better learn how to control these shoes before you—CRASH!!! Welp, you just shot through a plane. You need to learn more before you act next time.
